TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SocketOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines an interface for socket implementations to get and set socket options.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastIf = 16;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastIf = (16)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This is an IPv4-only socket option whose functionality is subsumed by and not implemented on Android.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastIf2 = 31;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastIf2 = (31)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This integer option sets the outgoing interface for multicast packets using an interface index.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastLoop = 18;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption IpMulticastLoop = (18)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option specifies whether the local loopback of multicast packets is enabled or disabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption IpTos = 3;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption IpTos = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This integer option specifies the value for the type-of-service field of the IPv4 header, or the traffic class field of the IPv6 header.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoBindaddr = 15;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoBindaddr = (15)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This option does not correspond to any Unix socket option and is not implemented on Android.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoBroadcast = 32;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoBroadcast = (32)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option can be used to enable or disable broadcasting on datagram sockets.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoKeepalive = 8;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoKeepalive = (8)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option specifies whether the kernel sends keepalive messages on connection-oriented sockets.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoLinger = 128;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoLinger = (128)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Number of seconds to wait when closing a socket if there is still some buffered data to be sent.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoOobinline = 4099;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoOobinline = (4099)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option specifies whether sending TCP urgent data is supported on this socket or not.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoRcvbuf = 4098;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoRcvbuf = (4098)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: The size in bytes of a socket's receive buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoReuseaddr = 4;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoReuseaddr = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option specifies whether a reuse of a local address is allowed when another socket has not yet been removed by the operating system.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoSndbuf = 4097;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoSndbuf = (4097)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: The size in bytes of a socket's send buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption SoTimeout = 4102;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption SoTimeout = (4102)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Integer timeout in milliseconds for blocking accept or read/receive operations (but not write/send operations).

MemberSignature.Value: public const Java.Net.SocketOption TcpNodelay = 1;
.field public static literal valuetype Java.Net.SocketOption TcpNodelay = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Net.SocketOption enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: This boolean option specifies whether data is sent immediately on this socket or buffered.
